data.question: What is the chemical formula of the clusters that connect into a twelve-connected fcu net in the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework?
What are the two linkers used in the synthesis of the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework?
data.answer: Terephthalate and fumarate

data.question: What is the role of formic acid in the synthesis of Zr-based MOF with mixed terephthalate and fumarate linkers?
data.answer: Formic acid is used as a modulator in the synthesis.

data.question: Can the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework with ordered terephthalate and fumarate linkers be synthesized in a single-step process?
data.answer: Yes, it can be synthesized in a single-step process.

data.question: What is the significance of using high-throughput synthesis methods in the discovery of new MOF phases?
data.answer: High-throughput synthesis methods enable the screening of a large number of reactions, accelerating the investigation of complex chemical spaces.

data.question: What distinguishes the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework with ordered linkers from other MOFs in terms of porosity?
data.answer: It retains three-dimensional porosity while creating two distinct windows within the channels, defining two distinct guest diffusion paths.

data.question: Is the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework with ordered terephthalate and fumarate linkers the first of its kind to be discovered?
data.answer: Yes, it is the first fcu Zr MOF with two windows discovered from a single-step synthesis.

data.question: What is the effect of using linkers with different lengths in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: Using linkers with different lengths can confer structural diversity on the products.

data.question: What is the crystal structure of UiO-66?
data.answer: UiO-66 has a face-centered cubic (fcu) topology.

data.question: Does the synthesis of the Zirconium-Based Metal-Organic Framework require a specific ratio of terephthalate to fumarate linkers?
data.answer: Yes, the synthesis requires a specific ratio of terephthalate to fumarate linkers.

data.question: What is the role of the liquid-handling robot in the synthesis process?
data.answer: The liquid-handling robot is used to prepare reaction mixtures, enabling the use of stock solutions of the reaction components.

data.question: What is the significance of the Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 structure in the context of MOF design?
data.answer: The Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 structure demonstrates the possibility of precisely controlling MOF porosity through multiple linker chemistry.

data.question: Is the Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 MOF characterized by a single type of window between the cages?
data.answer: No, the Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 MOF is characterized by two distinct types of window between the cages.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3?
data.answer: The BET surface area of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 is 783 m2 g@1.

data.question: What distinguishes the Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 MOF's structure from UiO-66 and MOF-801?
data.answer: The Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 MOF's structure is distinguished by its ordered arrangement of two distinct linkers, producing trigonally distorted tetrahedral and octahedral cages.

data.question: Does the presence of missing linkers affect the porous properties of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of missing linkers generates extra accessible space and decreases the density of the framework, affecting its porous properties.

data.question: What is the role of high-throughput experimental screening in the discovery of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3?
data.answer: High-throughput experimental screening enabled the fine compositional resolution screening necessary to isolate the new phase within a narrowed chemical space.

data.question: What is the crystal system of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3?
data.answer: Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 crystallizes in the R3Â¯ space group.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 limited to using ZrOCl2 as the metal source?
data.answer: No, the synthesis of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3 is not limited to using ZrOCl2; ZrCl4 can also be used as a starting material.

data.question: What is the impact of the ordered two-linker arrangement on the porosity of Zr6(BDC)3(Fum)3?
data.answer: The ordered two-linker arrangement controls the global porous properties, surface area, and pore volume, as well as the local ones, the size and the shape of the individual cages and windows.
